text_result.title: Periodic table - Wikipedia for Schools
text_result.fulltxt:
<ul>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> table is a tabular display of the chemical elements organized on the basis of their atomic numbers electron configurations and recurring chemical properties Elements are presented in order of increasing atomic number number of protons The<strong>  . . .</strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> of new theoretical models to explain chemical behaviour All elements from atomic numbers 1 hydrogen to 118 ununoctium have been discovered or synthesized Of these all up to and including californium exist naturally the rest have only<strong>. . . </strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> metal Other nonmetal Halogen Noble gas Lanthanide Actinide Colour of the atomic number shows state of matter at standard conditions 0 °C and 1 atm black Solid green Liquid red Gas grey Unknown Border shows natural occurrence   Pri<strong>. . . </strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> in order of increasing atomic number the number of protons in the nucleus of an atom A new row period is started when a new electron shell has its first electron Columns groups are determined by the electron configuration of the atom elements<strong>. . . </strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> properties of the elements can be explained by the electron shell theory of the atom they provided important evidence for the development and confirmation of quantum theory The electrons in the 4f-subshell which is progressively filled from<strong>. . . </strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> The first ionization energy is the energy it takes to remove one electron from an atom the second ionization energy is the energy it takes to remove a second electron from the atom and so on For a given atom successive ionization energies<strong>. . . </strong></li>
 </ul>

 <li><strong>. . . </strong> forms the most familiar of which is the mineral quartz In quartz each silicon atom is surrounded by four oxygen atoms that bridge to other silicon atoms to form a three dimensional lattice Silica is soluble in water at high temperatures<strong>. . . </strong></li>

<ul>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> albums credit the band as Pink Floyd produced by The Pink Floyd while 197 s Atom Heart Mother credits the band as The Pink Floyd produced by Pink Floyd David Gilmour is known to have referred to the group as The Pink Floyd as late as 1984<strong>  . . .</strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> Pink Floy s most popular release yet hitting UK 5 and making the U S charts at 74 Atom Heart Mother 1970 the ban s first recording with an orchestra was a collaboration with avant-garde composer Ron Geesin The name was a last minute decision by<strong>. . . </strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> and voice samples would thereafter be an important part of the ban s sound While Atom Heart Mother was considered a huge step back for the band at the time and is still considered one of its most inaccessible albums it had the best chart<strong>. . . </strong></li>
 </ul>
